alert.note: Alert for Lafayette (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 12 at 1:57AM EST until March 12 at 2:45AM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM EST FOR SOUTHERN LAFAYETTE COUNTY... At 157 AM EST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 12 miles southwest of Mayo, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... San Pedro Junction and Cooks Hammock. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: If a tornado or other severe weather is spotted, report it to the National Weather Service or your local nearest law enforcement agency who will send your report. This act may save lives of others in the path of dangerous weather.
